title: Married At First Sight star Clare Verrall shows off new tattoo in Byron Bay
text:
Unlucky-in-love Married At First Sight star Clare Verrall has proved she still believes in the L-word.

The 35-year-old shared a video to Instagram on Tuesday, which showed her getting the word 'love' inked in cursive writing on her right shoulder.

Smiling through the pain, Clare looked jubilant as she explained the meaning of her newest piece of body art to her fans.

Cute! Former Married At First Sight star Clare (pictured) shows off her new tattoo while on holiday with a group of girlfriends in Byron Bay

In the video filmed in Byron Bay, Clare could be seen laughing and joking while the tattoo artist finished up with the tattoo gun.

She wrote: 'This is for my love sisters. We're all getting a tattoo because we're basic b*****s, but also because this is the family we chose.'

Alongside the video, the reality star posted a picture of the finished product, seeming to be delighted with the final result.

'Tattoo number five #lovesisters,' Clare also wrote.

Smile! MAFS's Clare (pictured) looks delighted with her matching tattoo celebrating her best friends as she shows off the new ink on Instagram

A day earlier, Clare opened up on social media about her ongoing battle with anxiety and how being surrounded by friends in Byron was easing her struggle.

She posted: 'My anxiety which for some reason has crippled me of late simply washed away with the waves.

'My heart is filled with that fizzy feeling of joy that only weeks ago I was convinced I would never feel again.'

Looking good: MAFS's Clare Verrall (pictured) shows off her fabulous figure after losing 50kg in just 12 months

Clare was featured on season two of MAFS in 2016 when she was paired with tradesman Jono Pitman.

But her four-week stint on the show ended in tears with Clare revealing she'd suffered devastating mental health problems due to the pressure of the show.

She faced death threats from social media users and even attempted to commit suicide when she hit her lowest ebb.

Earlier this year, she vowed to never speak about MAFS again but just months later she launched a blistering attack on the show.
